articles.title: S. Korean workers shower stones on police
articles.content:
S. Korean workers shower stones on police
    Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- More than 2,000 unionists under the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions staged a demonstration following a "99 people's rally" for defending their vital rights in the plaza of Ryongsan Station in Seoul on Saturday, according to a radio report from Seoul.   They resisted the riot police with a stone-throwing battle.

articles.title: Move to favour "Yushin" remnants
articles.content:
Move to favour "Yushin" remnants
     Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The South Korean chief executive openly announced on May 13 that he would "assist" the "commemorations" of Park Chung Hee, a dictator of "Yushin",  arranged by "Yushin" remnants, according to a radio report from Seoul.     In order to court "Yushin" remnants' good faith he made this announcement at a government-sponsored function held in North Kyongsang Province, the birthplace of Park Chung Hee, three days ahead of May 16 when the anti-social and anti-national May 16 "military coup d'etat" was committed 38 years ago.
